title: Task 41

question.text: In the dialogue, what does Brian mean by by the end of it?

answers.feedback: This phrase is about reaching a conclusion, not necessarily stopping the activity.
Brian is referring to the end of the current investigation, not starting something new.
The phrase focuses on reaching an understanding at the end of the process, not taking a break.

answers.answer: They will have a clearer understanding of the situation after the investigation.

dialogue.text: Understood. We can investigate this together, and by the end of it, we should have a clearer picture of what's happening.

description: The phrase by the end of it is commonly used in English to refer to the conclusion or final part of a process or period of time. It implies that at the completion of a certain activity, a specific result or understanding will be achieved.
